results.title: Time bandits
results.creator_credit: Handmade Films Partnership and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: Time Bandits is a Pythonesque fantasy jaunt through time and space. The 11 year old hero finds his bedroom invaded by amiable, rascally dwarfs, absconding employees of the Supreme Being. They take him on an exhilarating journey through time and space. As might be expected, the giants of history and legend turn out to be engaging eccentrics.

results.title: Time after time
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Orion Pictures Corporation, Herb Jaffe and Nicholas Meyer
results.brief_description: An extraordinary premise lies at the heart of this fantasy thriller: in nineteenth century London, H.G. Wells (Malcolm McDowell) invents a time machine and inadvertently transports himself as well as the notorious Jack The Ripper (David Warner) to modern day San Francisco. What follows is at turns comic and terrifying as fish-out-of-water Wells seeks out the blood thirsty killer whose brutal rampage continues across the city. Whilst on the surface this picture makes innovative use of the quirks of time travel; underneath, “Time after time” investigates the utopian visions of a nineteenth century idealist as compared to the reality of twentieth century America; a society where Jack The Ripper finds himself thoroughly at home. Cast also includes Mary Steenburgen.

results.title: Tigerland [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Haft Entertainment, Kirch Media, New Regency Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Beau Flynn, Steven Haft, Arnon Milchan and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: Tigerland is the name of a military base in the United States used for the training of recruits before they are to be sent to fight in the war in Vietnam. The film follows the recruits as they are increasingly pushed to the edge of their physical and mental capabilities by a dehumanising military regime convinced that only by brutalising the men will they be able to sufficiently face the terrors of the war ahead. Starring Colin Farrell as Roland Bozz, a young man whose independent spirit and questioning mind puts him immediately at odds with authority, “Tigerland” is a punishing but compelling view of army life. The actual war is in the background. It is as a study of masculinity, repressed sexuality and violence that the film is most effective. Usually known for bloated big-budget action films, director Schumacher has instead, in “Tigerland”, utilised hand-held camerawork, minimal special effects and a concentration on the performances of the actors to achieve his effects. As a late addition to the genre of Vietnam war film, “Tigerland” lacks the immediacy and hallucinatory contradictions of films such as “Apocalypse Now” or “The Deerhunter”: in many ways, for all its kinetic editing and camerawork, it is a traditional genre film. Nevertheless, the performances and the energetic direction ensures that it is both exciting and confronting.

results.title: Tie me up! Tie me down! = Atame!
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, El Deseo S. A. and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: A satiric and explicit look at the battle of the sexes, examining how a man and a woman relate to each other when they are literally ‘bound’ together. Ricky (Antonio Banderas), a 23 year old ex-psychiatric patient chooses for his wife, Marina (Victoria Abril), a B-grade and porn movie queen with whom he spent a night during one of his many escapes from the institution. But when Ricky visits Marina on the set of her new movie, she doesn’t even recognise him. He figures that his only option is to kidnap her, confident that she will fall in love with him. An audacious and startlingly strangely funny film from Almodovar. Spanish dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Thunderstruck
results.creator_credit: ICON, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Showtime, Sony Music Australia, Jodi Matterson and Darren Ashton
results.brief_description: Four mates go on the road with a mission - to scatter the ashes of a friend on the grave of Bon Scott, original frontman for rock band AC/DC. Struggling in their own way with adulthood, the lads get the band back together to live out their promise made to each other 12 years ago - that should any of them die they would be buried out West next to Scott. Living out this pact is harder than they think with a lot of obstacles getting in the way on their life-changing journey. Written and directed by Darren Ashton (co-writer Shaun Angus Hall). Cast includes Damon Gameau, Stephen Curry, Ryan Johnson, Callan Mulvey, Sam Worthington.

results.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Malpaso Company, Robert Daley and Michael Cimino
results.brief_description: A golden field of wheat waves serenely under a blue Montana sky. A congregation of just-plain-folks in a quaint wooden church listens intently to the preacher. Then, just when you begin to wonder if you’ve somehow wandered into a Norman Rockwell painting, a man steps through the door and begins spraying the pulpit with automatic pistol fire. Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges star in this offbeat saga of a colourful group of bank robbers determined to “re-pull” a master heist of the fortress-like Montana Armoured Depository. In his directorial debut, Cimino injects the comedy-drama with an inventiveness and unpredictability rarely seen in the caper genre. Bridges received a Best Supporting Actor Academy Award nomination for his performance as Lightfoot.

results.title: Thunderbirds are go
results.creator_credit: Associated Television (Overseas) Ltd, Sylvia Anderson and David Lane
results.brief_description: The Tracy team launch a highly dangerous rescue mission in space in this first feature-length Thunderbirds classic. SZero X, a 21st century spacecraft, is suddenly blasted by a strange explosion as it leaves the Earth’s atmosphere bound for Mars. Is it sabotage? Can the Thunderbirds discover the perpetrators and save the next launch? This adventure film is gadget loaded and features visual effects by Derek Meddings as well as sound effects by some of London’s famous rock stars, including Cliff Richards.

results.title: Throw Momma from the train
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Larry Brezner and Danny DeVito
results.brief_description: Larry Donner (Billy Crystal) is not happy. His ex-wife has stolen his novel, reaping the financial rewards and giving Larry a serious case of writer’s block. To complicate matters Owen (Danny De Vito), a student in Larry’s creative writing class wants to participate in a murder-swap; Larry’s wife for Owen’s mother. This eventuates after Larry recommends Owen sees Hitchcock’s ‘Strangers on a train’ to assist in his writing. Owen misinterprets his intentions, taking the film literally. It seems like a simple task but killing Momma isn’t that easy! Written by Stu Silver.

results.title: Through the olive trees
results.creator_credit: Abbas Kiarostami Prod, Farabi Cinema Foundation and Abbas Kiarostami
results.brief_description: Iranian cinema in the last two decades of the twentieth century has proved to be one of few national cinemas offering an alternative to the dominance of Hollywood, both in terms of production and in terms of aesthetics. Kiarostami is one of the leading directors of post-revolutionary Iranian cinema and his work is intimately concerned with both the nature of human relationships and the power of cinema to influence and transform life. A film crew arrives in a small town devastated by a recent earthquake. Hossein, a young and homeless bricklayer is given a small role as a newly wed husband. The woman who is to play his wife is Tahereh, the girl he adores but who refuses to have anything to do with him. As the director attempts to get the two young people to play their roles in the script, Tahereh and Hossein enact their own drama and conflict in front of the camera. From this simple material, Kiarostami explores the tensions between men and women, reality and imagination, film and politics, and allows us as an audience to explore the ability of film as an art to seduce us even when it is lying to us. Without the use of special effects, big budgets or imaginary beings, “Through the Olive Trees” transports us to a magical world of human drama that Hollywood could not possibly emulate, no matter how much money or technology lies at its disposal.

results.title: Through a glass darkly
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Bergman’s “Through a glass darkly” centres on the lives of four characters. Karen (Harriet Andersson) suffers from schizophrenia and has just returned from hospital. She lives on a remote island in the Baltic with her husband Martin (Max Von Sydow) and brother Minus (Lars Passgard). David (Gunnar Bjornstrand), their father, is a novelist who returns from Switzerland to visit them. Gradually the severity of Karen’s illness becomes apparent to them all. Despite it’s dark subject matter “Through a glass darkly” is mesmerising to watch thanks to the outstanding performances by the four actors as well Sven Nykvist’s beautiful cinematography. Winner of 1961 Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. In Swedish with english subtitles.
